posts.post_content:
*"So, obviously followed footsteps + reaper king = game end."*  
-Donovan\_Fabian  
  
Maybe if you're playing Followed Footsteps on your opponent's Reaper King.Not a good idea for your own Reaper King-- Reaper King's legendary, so if two or more are in play, they all go to the graveyard due to the "legend rule." So much for that multiple-Reaper-King fantasy... unless you've got [Mirror Gallery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Gallery) out.

Posted By: atemu1234 (6/27/2013 8:23:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
"A Mr. Death is here. Something about a reaping?"  
  
He's one of the most fun commanders! Besides the obvious mana fixers, I get a lot of mileage from [Kaleidostone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kaleidostone) to draw a card and later bust it for 5 in the right colors to cast him. Make sure you've got some low cost protection to keep him alive after you drop him. I like [Mizzium Skin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mizzium Skin), [Turn Aside](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Turn Aside), and [Simic Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Simic Charm).   
  
His scarecrow tribe are a weird lot and you may find that cards like [Adaptive Automaton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adaptive Automaton), [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) work better than [Watchwing Scarecrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Watchwing Scarecrow) and [Rattleblaze Scarecrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rattleblaze Scarecrow).
posts.html:
"A Mr. Death is here. Something about a reaping?"

He's one of the most fun commanders! Besides the obvious mana fixers, I get a lot of mileage from Kaleidostone to draw a card and later bust it for 5 in the right colors to cast him. Make sure you've got some low cost protection to keep him alive after you drop him. I like Mizzium Skin, Turn Aside, and Simic Charm.

His scarecrow tribe are a weird lot and you may find that cards like Adaptive Automaton, Phyrexian Metamorph work better than Watchwing Scarecrow and Rattleblaze Scarecrow.

Posted By: psychichobo (6/12/2013 10:11:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I love everything about this card. Flavor text, art, rules text, creature type, casting cost. Like a few others who posted on this thread, he is the commander of my changeling/scarcrow Commander deck.  
  
With a suite of artifact mana fixers and another suite of multicolor removal, [dreadbore](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=dreadbore), [terminate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=terminate), [vindicate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=vindicate), [putrefy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=putrefy) and [wrecking ball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=wrecking ball), the deck is seriously removal heavy. I need to update the deck with some flicker effects to make it an even bigger threat.  
  
Just remember, [Painter's Servant](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Painter's Servant) is banned from commander decks.
posts.html:
I love everything about this card. Flavor text, art, rules text, creature type, casting cost. Like a few others who posted on this thread, he is the commander of my changeling/scarcrow Commander deck.

With a suite of artifact mana fixers and another suite of multicolor removal, dreadbore, terminate, vindicate, putrefy and wrecking ball, the deck is seriously removal heavy. I need to update the deck with some flicker effects to make it an even bigger threat.

Just remember, Painter's Servant is banned from commander decks.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Pantheon (4/11/2013 12:53:36 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card isn't the best in the world, but it's a beautifully designed card through and through.  
  
If you can get the reaper off, it's devastating (vindicate every time you toss out a scarecrow, or vindicates after flicker your board of scarecrows?)  
  
The flavor of this thing is off the chart.   
  
It's a Tribal Scarecrow lord, tying together all the wacky scarecrows throughout the Lorwyn/Shadowmoor blocks  
  
It's a fun card. Despite its cost and other prohibiting factors, it's a card that's fun wherever you play it, and you have to build smartly to bring out its potential.  
  
It is a masterfully made card. R&D did well with this one.
posts.html:
This card isn't the best in the world, but it's a beautifully designed card through and through.

If you can get the reaper off, it's devastating (vindicate every time you toss out a scarecrow, or vindicates after flicker your board of scarecrows?)

The flavor of this thing is off the chart.

It's a Tribal Scarecrow lord, tying together all the wacky scarecrows throughout the Lorwyn/Shadowmoor blocks

It's a fun card. Despite its cost and other prohibiting factors, it's a card that's fun wherever you play it, and you have to build smartly to bring out its potential.

It is a masterfully made card. R&D did well with this one.
